conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves to the back left or right.
The image shows four objects: a blue alarm clock, an egg, a rectangular object, and a white device with buttons. Each object casts a shadow labeled A, B, C, and D respectively.

When a light source moves, shadows change in two main ways: (1) Shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source, and (2) Shadows get longer when the light source is lower/more horizontal and shorter when the light source is higher/more vertical.

premise: The light source moves to the back left, and shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move toward the front right.

premise: The light source moves to the back left, and shadows get longer when the light source is lower/more horizontal.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become longer.

premise: The light source moves to the back right, and shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move toward the front left.

premise: The light source moves to the back right, and shadows get longer when the light source is lower/more horizontal.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become longer.

premise: When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D move toward the front right and become longer.
conclusion: When the light source moves to the back left, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift toward the front right of the image and become longer/larger.

premise: When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D move toward the front left and become longer.
conclusion: When the light source moves to the back right, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift toward the front left of the image and become longer/larger.

premise: When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D move toward the front right and become longer.
conclusion: A, B, C, and D move to the front right and become longer.
